state_analysis: The Makefile encountered a syntax error due to a missing separator, which is likely caused by incorrect indentation or formatting in the generated Makefile. The project has not been compiled successfully, and thus the test program does not exist yet.
explanation: I will correct the Makefile by ensuring proper indentation and syntax. Specifically, I will replace spaces with tabs for the command lines in the Makefile, as make expects commands to be indented with tabs not spaces. After correcting it, I will attempt to compile the project again and run the test program.

commands.keystrokes:
echo -e 'FC=gfortran
OBJ=my_lib.o test_main.o
all:
\t$(FC) -o test_program $(OBJ)
my_lib.o: my_lib.f90
\t$(FC) -c my_lib.f90
test_main.o: test_main.f90
\t$(FC) -c test_main.f90
clean:
\trm -f *.o test_program' > src/Makefile
